notes: The site is a former police station building but the police has relocated to another premises within the town so the service will continue to be provided in an equally accessible location. site-address: Jewsons Depot, Gosport Street, Lymington
notes: This site is currently in use as a builderâ€™s merchant but the occupier is interested in making the site available for residential-led redevelopment. The builder's merchant use is not particularly appropriate for the site given its close proximity to residential properties that adjoin the site. Given its location the site has potential for high density residential-led mixed use development. The adopted Local Plan Part 2 (2014) currently identifies this site as a town centre office opportunity (LYM8.6) and that other uses may be acceptable on upper floors. 10 flats
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

Given its location on the edge of the town centre, the character of the site and the immediate area adjacent to the site, this site has significant potential to accommodate mixed use development at a high density. he adopted Local Plan Part 2 (2014) currently identifies this site as a town centre opportunity (LYM8.4). Around 100 dwellings
ownership-status: owned by a public authority

site-address: Land south of New Milton Station, New Milton
notes: This is a town centre site that currently functions as the railway station car park, a car hire yard and storage area. There is an opportunity to optimise this site and make the most effective use of land through a well-designed residential-led redevelopment scheme. Redevelopment would have potential to bring visual/economic/social enhancements and make best use of a prominent town centre site. Development would need to ensure the proper functioning of the station and station car park is not undermined. Potential for high density residential development of four storeys in principle. Around 75 dwellings
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

site-address: Land south of Manor Road, New Milton
notes: This site is currently occupied by a range of commercial uses including a builders merchant and a car repair garage. There is an opportunity for redevelopment that can optimise the site and bring visual/environmental enhancements to this prominent gateway site to New Milton town centre. Given its town centre location, the site could accommodate a well-designed high density mixed-use scheme comprising commercial uses on the ground floor and residential uses on upper floors. Redevelopment would have potential to bring visual/economic/social enhancements to New Milton town centre. Around 35 dwellings
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

site-address: Land north of Osborne Road, New Milton
notes: This town centre site is currently in use as a car park and as a car repair/sales garage. There is an opportunity for redevelopment of the site that optimises the use of the site and makes most efficient use of land. The Listed Broadway Tower will be an important consideration in any development proposal. Given its town centre location, the site could accommodate a well-designed high density mixed-use scheme comprising commercial uses on the ground floor and residential uses on upper floors. Redevelopment would have potential to bring visual/economic/social enhancements to New Milton town centre. Around 20 dwellings
ownership-status: mixed ownership

site-address: Totton Shopping Centre, Totton
notes: This town centre site offers opportunity for comprehensive mixed use redevelopment and significant enhancements to the whole site including the construction of a new frontage building of three or four storeys on the south west corner of the site as set out in the Totton Town Centre SPG, and on the north west corner of the site. Residential uses (approximately 20 flats) could be appropriately located in the areas of the site that are in Flood Zone 1. Parts of the site are within Flood Zone 3. 20 flats on upper floors as part of a comprehensive mixed use development of the whole site
